alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 12:03PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Just south-southwest of Gray Mountain in Coconino County, including portions of Highway 89. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways, including portions of Highway 89, will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Lava Wash, Hulls Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Ball Court Wash, Cedar Wash, Needmore Wash, Campbell Francis Wash, Mays Wash and Deadman Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wupatki National Monument and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 438 and 455. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
